content: @nikomatsakis These error messages are really bad and are one of the few things blocking moving to -Zborrowck=mir by default. I've managed to do better for cases where the error comes from subtyping with a bit of effort. However some of these errors come from constraints generated by canonical queries, where we have no way currently to transfer error information to the caller. Is there an existing plan for how to improve errors from queries?
Not really, I've thought a little about it, but not enough to have a firm plan.
I think I was considering a few possibilities
One of them was including error information in some form
The other was to have some way to "repeat" the computation, but this time get the error information out
That would be needed only as a perf optimization
@Matthew Jasper btw I was going to push a test case to #72493 as a kind of "drive-by" fix for #57642
